intro: Melampyrum montanum, commonly known as the mountain touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange-red, with two lips, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Melampyrum montanum is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cooler, temperate climates.
